$comment: This file was automatically generated, do not modify it by hand. Instead, modify the source Typescript file, and run `pnpm types build:catalog-schemas`.
title: Catalog application item manifest
description: Data model of a Catalog application item to apply

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying this object.

categoryId.description: The unique identifier of this item's version's category.

description.description: A brief description of this item.

documentation.description: A reference to the documentation regarding this item.

url.description: The URL where to reach for the documentation.

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with this item.

itemId.description: A string that, alongside with `.version.name`, uniquely identifies this item within its namespace (`.tenantId`). Read-only.

itemTypeDefinitionRef.description: The reference to an Item Type Definition in the form of its composite primary key. Read-only.

name.description: The name of the Item Type Definition (references its `.metadata.name`).

namespace.description: The identifier of the Item Type Definition namespace (references its `.metadata.namespace.id`).

labels.description: A map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects.

lifecycleStatus.description: The lifecycle status of this item.

url.description: The URL in standard URI format.

displayName.description: A user-friendly title for the link.

maintainers.description: A list of organizational entities maintaining this object.

name.description: The display name of the maintainer.

email.description: A contact email of the maintainer.

name.description: The human-readable title of this item.

providerId.description: The identifier of the provider used to retrieve markdown documentation content and external resources, if supported by the item's type.

relationships.description: A list of relationships from this item to any other entity (either part of the Software Catalog or not).

target.description: The receiving end of the relationships. It can be a URN-reference to another Software Catalog entity or an arbitrary string.

type.description: The type of the relationships. It can be one of the Software Catalog well-known relationships or an arbitrary string.

releaseDate.description: The time when this item was published.

repositoryUrl.description: The URL of the repository containing the source code of the resource(s) created by this item.

collections.description: Collections to be created with the application. The key of each collection MUST be equal to the collection `defaultName` property. Collections only work if a Mia-Platform CRUD Service is already in the project or is created through the application itself.

endpoints.description: Endpoints to be created with the application. The key of each endpoint MUST be equal to the endpoint `defaultBasePath` property. Endpoints only work if a Mia-Platform API Gateway is already in the project or is created through the application itself.

services.description: Services to be created with the application. The key of each service MUST be equal to the service `name` property

name.description: The variable name (generally, a key written in UPPER_SNAKE_CASE)

description.description: A brief description of the variable

managedBy.description: A string that represents the Console section that manages the variable. It only works used in combination with the `readOnly` property set to `true`

readOnly.description: A boolean that represents if you can change the value of the variable through the Console

value.description: The variable default value. It can contain placeholders that will be replaced with the actual values when the service is created

defaultProbes.description: The readiness, liveness, and startup paths of the service. By modifying the map of the probes, you can overwrite the default paths applied by the Console

defaultResources.description: CPU and memory limitations of the service, which can be used to overwrite the default limitations imposed by the Console for these parameters

defaultAnnotations.description: The service annotations, which can be used to provide additional information about your services for various purposes. Annotations starting with `mia-platform.eu` are reserved

defaultConfigMaps.description: The default ConfigMaps, if any, that will be mounted inside the container of the microservice

defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: The environment variables that will overwrite the default environment variables applied by the Console

containerName.description: The name of the container where the field is located

defaultLabels.description: The service labels, which can be used to categorize, group, and select your service. Labels starting with "mia-platform.eu" are reserved

defaultProbes.description: The readiness, liveness, and startup paths of the service. By modifying the map of the probes, you can overwrite the default paths applied by the Console

defaultResources.description: CPU and memory limitations of the service, which can be used to overwrite the default limitations imposed by the Console for these parameters

defaultSecrets.description: The default secrets, if any, to be mounted inside the container of the microservice

links.description: Custom links to other Console pages

enableIf.description: The name of a feature toggle to be used to optionally display the link

hidePrefix.description: Flag stating if the `label` should not be prefixed by a "View" copy

label.description: The label to be shown in the link button. It does not support internationalization. Unless property `hidePrefix` is set to `false`, the label will be shown right next to a "View" copy

targetSection.description: The name of the registered microfrontend where the link should land

defaultAnnotations.description: The service annotations, which can be used to provide additional information about your services for various purposes. Annotations starting with `mia-platform.eu` are reserved

defaultConfigMaps.description: The default ConfigMaps, if any, that will be mounted inside the container of the microservice

defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: The environment variables that will overwrite the default environment variables applied by the Console

supportedBy.description: The identifier of the company that has produced this item.

supportedByImageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with the company that has produced this item.

tenantId.description: The identifier of the tenant to which this item belongs. Within this tenant, the combination of the `.name` and the `.version.name` of this item must be unique. Read-only.

visibility.description: The visibility of this item. It can be public (i.e., visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console), "all tenants" (i.e., visible to all tenants of the Console installation), or private (i.e., only visible to the item's tenant).

allTenants.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to all tenants of the Console installation.

public.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console.

examples.description: A standardized service to handle orders from an e-commerce website.
examples.name: Order Service

version.releaseNote:
# About this version

The first release of the service 🎉
